comments.creator: mconley@mozilla.com
comments.text:
Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b13pre) Gecko/20110314 Thunderbird/3.3a3

Using Microsoft Outlook 2010

Steps to reproduce:

1)  Open up Outlook, and create a new Contact Group, and add some entries.
2)  Follow the instructions in http://ilias.ca/blog/2006/03/outlook-and-oe-address-book-support-in-thunderbird/ to get TB to read the Outlook address book
3)  Open up TB, go to the address book, and check the contact list under "OP Contacts"

What happens:

Each entry in the Outlook contact group appears twice.

What's expected:

Each entry should only appear once.
comments.author: mconley@mozilla.com

Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b13pre) Gecko/20110314 Thunderbird/3.3a3

Using Microsoft Outlook 2010

Steps to reproduce:

1)  Open up Outlook, and create a new Contact Group, and add some entries.
2)  Follow the instructions in http://ilias.ca/blog/2006/03/outlook-and-oe-address-book-support-in-thunderbird/ to get TB to read the Outlook address book
3)  Open up TB, go to the address book, and check the contact list under "OP Contacts"

What happens:

Each entry in the Outlook contact group appears twice.

What's expected:

Each entry should only appear once.
